FuncDef:
The dfs-group port-group command binds a DFS group to a user-side protection group.
The undo dfs-group port-group command unbinds a DFS group from a user-side protection group. The dfs-group port-group command binds a DFS group to a user-side protection group. The undo dfs-group port-group command unbinds a DFS group from a user-side protection group. By default, no DFS group is bound to a user-side protection group. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE8850-SAN, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a DFS group.
The value is 1.

Specifies the ID of the active/standby protection group.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 1024.

ExtraInfo: The dfs-group port-group command needs to be configured only when the active and standby network adapters of the access device are connected to two M-LAG devices for multicast traffic forwarding. In addition, the port-group IDs configured on the two M-LAG devices must be the same. In other scenarios, only the dfs-group m-lag command needs to be configured.
